{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3335440,"name":"Marko","username":"MarkoKupresanin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/markokupresanin/{size}/197936_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T22:55:05.875Z","cooked":"

Our team uses Play Station DualShock 4 Controllers for our driver and operator and I was wondering if it is possible to use WPILib to set up the controllers to turn a certain color for the driver and a separate one for the operator, that way we can quickly see which controller is on what port without having to always pull up the tab in Driver Station.

I tried looking through the documentation here but I don’t seem to notice anything about the lightbar.

Does anyone know if this is possible to accomplish through code? Or would we only be able to do it through the DS4 app? Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-17T22:55:05.875Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":111,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":574.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459019,"topic_slug":"changing-the-color-of-the-ps4-controller-lightbar","display_username":"Marko","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://first.wpi.edu/wpilib/allwpilib/docs/development/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/PS4Controller.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57526,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/changing-the-color-of-the-ps4-controller-lightbar/459019/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3335447,"name":"Manish Reddy","username":"Manish_R","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/manish_r/{size}/215201_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T23:03:16.513Z","cooked":"

Check out this post:

Dualsense controller Programming
The class you want is PS4Controller (there is no PS5 one, but PS4 should work?), and the functions you want to look at are setOutput() and setRumble(). I don’t know if setOutput() will actually control the LEDs though; if it doesn’t there’s no way to do it. PS4Controller controller = new PS4Controller(1); // assuming 1 is assignment in DS … controller.setRumble(GenericHID.RumbleType.kLeft, 1.0); controller.setOutput(1, true);

Thanks for the reference! It seems that the setOutput() method isn’t very well documented from what I can see though… I tried using it with different values and seeing if the controllers changed colors but it wasn’t doing anything. I might try to look through the DS4 app’s source code and see how they implement the functionality of changing the color to be anything.
